meanings.definition: A line separating two countries, administrative divisions, or areas.
meanings.sent1: The border between the two countries was heavily guarded.
meanings.sent2: She stood at the border of the forest, hesitant to enter.
meanings.sent3: The border seemed to play hide and seek with the travelers.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a border, defining where one ended and the other began.
meanings.sent5: The border was drawn with a bold red line on the map.

meanings.definition: The edge or boundary of something.
meanings.sent1: The garden's border was lined with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: He painted the border of the picture frame in gold.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to walk along the border of the garden beds.
meanings.sent4: The border of the cliff was a sheer drop to the ocean below.
meanings.sent5: The border of the puzzle was the hardest part to complete.

meanings.definition: To be adjacent to or next to something.
meanings.sent1: Their house borders the park, providing a lovely view.
meanings.sent2: The field borders the river, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent3: The two neighbors often border on arguing about the fence line.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts would often border on obsession with the project.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room would border on chaos during the surprise party.
